result.execSummary:
The defendant Ed D Pierson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO THIS CASE:  Pay all applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharges, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervison fees as determined by DOC.  To be paid as a condition of Extended supervison under case 13fCF3406.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three, and consecutive to all other sentences.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, and consecutive to any other sentences.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ed D Pierson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ed Pierson in court with attorney Scott D Obernberger.  Defendant Ed Pierson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Upon motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the Use of a Dangerous Weapon Enhancer on COUNT #2.

 Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1 and COUNT #4, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

  AS TO COUNT #2 (w/o dangerous weapon), and COUNT #3, Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Sister of defendant.

 AS TO COUNT #2: (w/o dangerous weapon), Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS, (CONCURRENT to Count #3) and (CONSECUTIVE to all other sentences), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  

AS TO COUNT #3: Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS (CONCURRENT to Count #2) and (CONSECUTIVE to all other sentences), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, as a condition of extended supervision under case 2013CF3406, or if not paid a CIVIL JUDGMENT.  


Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 5-5-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

 Court waived the appearanceof defendant at the request of defense counsel.  Adjournment of the Jury Trial requested by the State, based on sustantial additional discovery turned over to defense counsel, today's date.  State will also be charging the co-actor today on case 2013CF3406.  Court heard and granted the State's Motion to Adjourn the Jury Trial.  Defense is opposed to State's Motion to Adjourn Trial. (hard copy), from defense counsel, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Ed D. Pierson in court with Attorney Scott D Obernberger.  Defendant Ed D Pierson in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Greg Genisse.   Court takes judicial notice of the certified records attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty on all counts not previously entered.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery.  

Upon the motion of the State, the Court ordered the following cases CONSOLIDATED for the purposes of trial:  Cases 2013CM2977, 2013CF3406 and 2014CF108.  Defense does not object to the joinder of cases.  

Court ordered cash bail revoked in the amount of $500.00 on case 2013CM2977 and to be held for recompense.
Court ordered cash bail revoked in the amount of $2,500 on case 2013CF3406 and to be held for recompense.  

Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 2-18-2014 and Jury Trial on 3-10-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jada J

Defendant Ed D Pierson in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Ed D Pierson in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 1, 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
